citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During record review, it was discovered that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to review
their program for humane care and use of animals at the required six-month interval. The last review was performed on
June 12, 2024 and was next due by December 2024. However, it was not completed until May/June 2025. Failure to
review the program for humane care and use of animals at the interval indicated within the Animal Welfare Act (AWA)
could negatively impact the animals covered under the program by misidentifying program discrepancies, and therefore
effect their welfare. With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall
review, at least once every six months, the research facility’s program for humane care and use of animals, using title 9,
chapter I, subchapter A – Animal Welfare, as a basis for evaluation.
Correct by: August 27, 2025

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During record review, it was discovered that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to submit
the reports from their 2024 program for humane care and use of animals review and 2024-2025 facilities inspection to the
Institutional Official (IO). Failure to provide these reports to the IO hinders their ability to verify the facility's compliance
with the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must prepare reports of its evaluations conducted as required by paragraphs
(c)(1) and (2) of this section, and submit the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility.
Correct by: August 27, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(1) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
During record review, it was discovered that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to review 
their program for humane care and use of animals at the required six-month interval. The last review was performed on 
June 12, 2024 and was next due by December 2024. However, it was not completed until May/June 2025. Failure to 
review the program for humane care and use of animals at the interval indicated within the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) 
could negatively impact the animals covered under the program by misidentifying program discrepancies, and therefore 
effect their welfare. With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall 
review, at least once every six months, the research facility’s program for humane care and use of animals, using title 9, 
chapter I, subchapter A – Animal Welfare, as a basis for evaluation.  
 
Correct by: August 27, 2025 
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
During record review, it was discovered that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to submit 
the reports from their 2024 program for humane care and use of animals review and 2024-2025 facilities inspection to the 
Institutional Official (IO). Failure to provide these reports to the IO hinders their ability to verify the facility's compliance 
with the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must prepare reports of its evaluations conducted as required by paragraphs 
(c)(1) and (2) of this section, and submit the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility. 
 
Correct by: August 27, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
